programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The top-ranked Tigers go for their 31st straight regular-season victory when they host the Bulldogs. Clemson routed Wake Forest 37-13 in its 2020 opener. The Tigers have won 17 in a row versus The Citadel, last losing to their in-state foe in 1931.(n)

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Trojans get set to begin their season when they travel to battle the Blue Raiders. Middle Tennessee (0-1) was thrashed 42-0 by Army in its 2020 opener. The Blue Raiders defeated the Trojans 24-21 in 2012 to snap a six-game series slide.(n)

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Panthers try to continue their dominance of the Orange. Pittsburgh has won two straight and 15 of the last 18 meetings with Syracuse. The Panthers opened 2020 with a 55-0 victory over Austin Peay while Syracuse lost at No. 18 North Carolina 31-6.(n)

programme.title: College Football 150: The American Game
programme.desc: As football professionalized, the college game was deeply impacted and forever changed. The two sports are closely connected -- and the conflict between amateur and pro will always undeniably shadow the college game.(n)

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: An all-Sooner State contest sees the Golden Hurricane face the Cowboys. Oklahoma State ended an 8-5 campaign in 2019 with a loss to former conference rival Texas A&M in the Texas Bowl. Tulsa seeks its first win over Oklahoma State since 1998.(n)

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The 1-0 Ragin' Cajuns aim to keep rolling as they visit the Panthers in the Peach State. Louisiana-Lafayette scored the first upset of the 2020 season by taking down No. 23 Iowa State 31-14 on Sept. 12. This serves as Georgia State's opening game.(n)

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Midshipmen try to bounce back from a lopsided season-opening loss when they visit the Green Wave. Navy was flattened 55-3 by BYU on Sept. 7. The Midshipmen edged the Green Wave 41-38 in 2019 on Bijan Nichols' 48-yard field goal as time expired.(n)

programme.title: The Beach Boys: Breaking the Band
programme.desc: In the mid 1960s, with hits like ``Surfin' USA'' and ``Good Vibrations,'' the Beach Boys become the carefree sound of American youth; on stage, the band members seem like a happy family, but nothing is further from the truth.(n)

programme.title: Simon & Garfunkel: Breaking the Band
programme.desc: Simon & Garfunkel are the most successful folk-rock duo of the 1960s selling almost 40 million albums worldwide; their distinct melodies and songs help define a decade, but at the height of their success, the duo splits up.(n)

programme.title: Sonny & Cher: Breaking the Band
programme.desc: In 1974 Cher filed for divorce from her husband, Sonny; it was a scandalous end for the duo, who had charmed America with their kooky relationship and heartfelt songs.(n)

programme.title: The Mamas & The Papas: Breaking the Band
programme.desc: The Mamas and The Papas is one of the most iconic groups of the Swinging Sixties; the unique vocal harmonies and timeless pop melodies catapulted the band to the top of the Billboard charts.(n)

programme.title: The Eagles: Breaking the Band
programme.desc: The Eagles are one of the biggest bands in history, selling over 150 million records; ``Hotel California,'' ``Take It Easy'' and other hit songs define the 1970s, and their greatest hits album is the best-selling album of the 20th century.(n)

programme.title: The Police: Breaking the Band
programme.desc: In the early 1980s, The Police were hailed as the biggest band in the world, selling over 50 million albums; Sting, Andy Summers and Stewart Copeland dominated the charts and filled stadiums, but they split while at the peak of their stardom.(n)

programme.title: KISS: Breaking The Band
